Package es.courserajava.edu.duke

Class ImageResource

java.lang.Object
es.courserajava.edu.duke.ImageResource
public class ImageResource extends Object
The ImageResource class represents an image as a grid of Pixel objects and allows access to all of them, using the method pixels. These pixels can then be iterated over using a for loop.

Note, no changes made to the pixels in this image affect the original image opened unless you use the method save.

Example usage: 

 ImageResource image = new ImageResource();
 for (Pixel p : image.pixels()) {
     int red = p.getRed();
     int green = p.getGreen();
     int blue = p.getBlue();
     int average = (red + green + blue) / 3;
     p.setRed(average);
     p.setGreen(average);
     p.setBlue(average);
 }
 image.draw();

This is open-source software released under the terms of the GPL (http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ImageResource()
    Create an ImageResource object that represents the file chosen by the user using a file selection dialog box.

    Create an ImageResource object whose size is the width and height passed as parameters and whose pixels are all black.
    ImageResource(ImageResource other)
    Create an ImageResource object that is a copy of another image.
    ImageResource(File file)
    Create an ImageResource object from a file given as a parameter.
    ImageResource(String fileName)
    Create an ImageResource object from the file name passed as a parameter.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageResource

      public ImageResource()
      Create an ImageResource object that represents the file chosen by the user using a file selection dialog box.
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if no file is selected by the user

    • ImageResource

      public ImageResource(int width, int height)
      Create an ImageResource object whose size is the width and height passed as parameters and whose pixels are all black.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the image in pixels
      height - the height of the image in pixels
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if the width or height are not positive values

    • ImageResource

      public ImageResource(String fileName)
      Create an ImageResource object from the file name passed as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if the file cannot be accessed or is not in an image format

    • ImageResource

      public ImageResource(File file)
      Create an ImageResource object from a file given as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      file - the file representing an image
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if the file cannot be accessed or is not in an image format

    • ImageResource

      public ImageResource(ImageResource other)
      Create an ImageResource object that is a copy of another image.
      Parameters:
      other - the original image being copied

      public void draw()
      Displays this image in a separate window.

    • getFileName

      public String getFileName()
      Returns the file name associated with this image.
      Returns:
      the name of the file used to create this image or an empty string if it was created as a sized image

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName(String name)
      Resets the file name associated with this image. Useful, for example, when saving the results of changes to this image in a different file than the original.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the file

    • getPixel

      public Pixel getPixel(int x, int y)
      Returns the pixel at the (x, y) coordinates passed as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      x - the column position of the pixel
      y - the row position of the pixel
      Returns:
      the Pixel at the given (x, y) coordinates

    • setPixel

      public void setPixel(int x, int y, Pixel p)
      Resets the pixel at the given (x, y) coordinates but does not redraw it.
      Parameters:
      x - the column position of the pixel
      y - the row position of the pixel
      p - the new pixel values to use

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the image (file name, width, and height).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the image

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves the image as a JPEG using its current file name or opens a file selection dialog box to allow the user to choose a name if no file name set (for example if this image was created as a blank sized image).
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if the current filename cannot be accessed for saving

    • saveAs

      public void saveAs()
      Saves the image as a JPEG by opening a file selection dialog box to allow the user to choose the new name for the file.
      Throws:
      ResourceException - if no file is selected by the user
